item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description:
The lectures of the 2023 UCL Neuropixels course are now on YouTube:
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfhWmWntvjl7kljKozClpjS29DoY8V5pB&si=UjCmdEFyjZR5BE6ZThe lectures are brief (typically 10-20 minutes) and packed with information. They are a great way to get an introduction to #Neuropixels, and to get up to speed on the latest developments. Thank you to @EnnyvBeest and Celian Bimbard for organizing a fantastic course, and to the lecturers for doing an amazing job!(more info on the course is at https://www.ucl.ac.uk/neuropixels/training/2023-neuropixels-course).

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: Update on tracking neurons across days in #Neuropixels recordings: @EnnyvBeest gave a nice talk on it, where she explains UnitMatch. It's a brief talk and it's available online: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4c_dgTZcBaQ&list=PLfhWmWntvjl7kljKozClpjS29DoY8V5pB&index=23&ab_channel=MatteoCarandini

item.title: Dhananjay Thakur
item.description:
Is there a good guide or review that discusses mechanical artifacts in electrophysiology? Hopefully something ranging in scale from the "patch-creep" seen in single channel recordings to movement artifacts in field potentials? #ephys
#neuroscience #Neuromatch

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: I'm almost half-way through my upper level EM Fields & Waves class for EE majors. I was doing it as 100% chalkboard work. https://neuromatch.social/@sls/110872769696693376 However, a couple of students said that they'd prefer if I used a tablet + projector, and then post the PDF after class. So I'm trying that. It's nice in some ways. I get less chalk dust on my suits. And it's a bit faster because they don't have to wait for me to walk back and forth across the room erasing the board. But projectors are so low resolution that I feel like I'm working equations with crayons on small notecards. I prefer to draw a diagram, maybe an equation, and then leave that up while I work through the rest of the math., and that's a bit awkward. At least for me at the moment. I'm using Notasium and it's okay. I tried Good Notes but it annoyed me before I got very far. Are there other apps I should try?

item.title: Vladimir Volkov
item.description: As my group is slowly approaching size > 1, it's time for the new lab website: www.volkovlab.com. Will be soon looking for a postdoc and a technician (both funded by @bbsrc for 3 years). While the HR approve the official ads, feel free to reach out! A boost is highly appreciated

item.title: ScienceGirl
item.description:
Hello #Mastodon! I am making the jump from X to here. Too many of my #science and #medicine buddies left X. If you switched from X, how do you like it here?
#introductions

item.description:
Three articles published yesterday in #Science, Science Advances & Nature ü§îWomen remain underrepresented among faculty in nearly all academic fields https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/sciadv.adi2205Toxic workplaces are the main reason women leave academic jobs https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-03251-8Women faculty feel ‚Äòpushed‚Äô from academia by poor workplace climate
https://www.science.org/content/article/women-faculty-feel-pushed-academia-poor-workplace-climate

item.title: Erica Gies / SlowWater.world
item.description: Scientists found that deforestation reduces rain because missing trees can't transpire vapor. Hydroclimatologist Francina Dominguez found a bigger cause: intact forests have a rougher surface, slowing wind, giving vapor more time to condense into rain. My story for Nature Water: https://www.nature.com/articles/s44221-023-00143-z

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Job Ad: UC Santa Barbara: Assistant Professor- Tenure Track Position in the Broad Area of Autonomous Robotic Systems. https://recruit.ap.ucsb.edu/JPF02590 The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) is accepting applications for a tenure track position at the Assistant Professor level in the broad area of Autonomous Robotic Systems. The Department has particular (but non-exclusive) interest in applicants with expertise in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or controls, along with the ability to complement existing faculty strengths in fields such as automation, robotics, computer vision, optimization, and signal processing.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
Another job at at UC Santa Barbara: https://recruit.ap.ucsb.edu/JPF02597
Tenure- track Assistant Professor level in autonomous systems and robotics. in the MechE dept.
